description.raw:
One level per tile \(tunnels or blockers\), using @{557058:10b01d41-a2e9-4a41-a907-e6e2f03b6cd5} 's script. All tiles within a 55m radius of the robot are loaded. That's far enough that no lidars or lights can reach it.

See the world with X1:

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/8ze6Mjd/images/2003316297-levels_1.png)
As the robot moves, new levels are loaded. Teleporting it for example:

`ign service -s /world/tunnel_circuit_practice_01/set_pose --reqtype ignition.msgs.Pose --reptype ignition.msgs.Boolean --timeout 300 --req 'name: "X1", position: {x: 140, y: 0, z: 1}'`

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/8ze6Mjd/images/2887088677-levels_2.png)
To prevent RGB cameras from seeing empty tunnel holes, the scene background is set to black. That's done only for sensors so that the GUI is still bright to ease debugging:

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/8ze6Mjd/images/131587404-levels_3.png)
This changes the robot's view of the world before entering the tunnel though. It's like it's night outside :wink:

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/8ze6Mjd/images/3066497912-levels_4.png)
